title: Sea anemones are ingesting plastic microfibers

title_detail.value: Sea anemones are ingesting plastic microfibers

summary: Tiny fragments of plastic in the ocean are consumed by sea anemones along with their food, and bleached anemones retain these microfibers longer than healthy ones, according to new research. The work is the first-ever investigation of the interactions between plastic microfibers and sea anemones, which are closely related to corals.
